  ∫e^x*cos(x) dx = e^x*cos(x) - ∫e^x*(-sin(x)) dx
                 = e^x*cos(x) + ∫e^x*sin(x) dx

Now, we need to integrate ∫e^x*sin(x) dx, which can also be done using integration by parts. After performing integration by parts twice for both integrals, we will get:
